name: Avoid large Classes - too many Methods (Kotlin)
description:
Classes should have less than X Methods.
The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all the Classes having more than X Methods.
It provides the following information:
 - Class full name
 - Number of Methods
rationale: For maintainability and readability reasons, Classes should not have too many Methods.
remediation: Review the Class design to reduce the number of Methods
alternativeName: Avoid large Classes - too many Methods (Kotlin)

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
